abstract: Home prices are falling across most of America.
snippet: Home prices are falling across most of America.
lead_paragraph: The housing market keeps sinking, and what is remarkable about it is how national the slide is. The S.&P. Case-Shiller home price indexes, out today, show year-over-year declines in 14 of 20 major markets. (Those markets are regional areas, with New York’s area stretching from Trenton to New Haven.) That is a record number for that index, but it only goes back to the late 1980s.
